duties_responsibilities.duty: Conduct surveillance and investigations using epidemiologic principles to identify and track infections in hospital patients and employees.
Assist in the development of the Infection Control Program and recommend, monitor, and evaluate the effectiveness of infection control interventions.
Analyze infection control surveillance data and report findings to relevant stakeholders.
Maintain certification in Infection Control and advance knowledge and skills through continuing education.
Develop, implement, and evaluate educational programs related to infection prevention and control.
Monitor infection rates, provide consultation, counseling, and education, and communicate with health departments and regulatory agencies.

education_certification.credential: BS in Nursing with current licensure by New York State as a Registered Nurse, active Certification endorsed by the Certification Board of Infection Control (CBIC) or actively seeking certification. Masters in Nursing, Epidemiology, or other health-related field preferred.
